reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is fantastic. We arrived around 10 am and they let us have our room immediately. The travel from Denver was about 12 hours flying time + several hours in the airports + 2 hours driving to Rothenburg o d T. We tried to do some sightseeing but we were just too exhausted and the MOST comfortable bed was waiting for us in room 21. The pillows were like clouds from heaven. The bed was incredible. We fell asleep watching our flat screen TV. After a nap I took a long soak in the fabulous large soaker tub in the huge bathroom.
reviews.title: Modern Conveniences with Medieval Charm

reviews.text: It is located close to the city center. It was the nicest place we stayed on our 2 week vacation.
reviews.title: Totally loved the hotel :)

reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent with a wide variety of choices.
reviews.title: Wonderful room

reviews.text: I recommend the Night Watchman tour at 8 pm in the town square and the Medieval Crime Museum. We enjoyed wine at the Trinstube zur Holle close to the museum.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Hotel Gotisches Haus is an amazing hotel with so much character :) I can't find one fault with it as the room we stayed in was lovely and the staff were friendly. Infact after arriving at Hotel Gotisches Haus after a very long (12 hour) bike journery from the UK, the moring after, we were so tired that we missed our breakfast. On expaining the situation they didn't hesitate in preparing a tray and bringing us our breakfast to our room. It was nice touches like this that allow me to rate this hotel as high as we do.
reviews.title: Best Place we Stayed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here on our first two nights in Germany and this was one of the best hotels of our 2 week stay. The location is very close to all of the best parts of the old city and the bathroom was the best we have EVER had in Europe! I would definitely stay here again and Rothenburg is a very charming little place. Make sure to check out the cute light fixture just as you walk in the front entrance - it is a replica of the city made into a light!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've just returned from a night at this delightful small hotel in Rothenburg. Hotel is located less than 100m from the Market Square, and is therefore ideally located. The rooms have been totally refurbished, to create a modern yet rustic feel. Our room (number 21) was large and overlooked the street to the front - no noise due to double glazing. The bathroom was very big - with a bath, a large shower and twin basins. Satellite TV. Staff were friendly and helpful. Note that hotel kitchen is closed for whole of 2008 for refurbishment (we were advised when booking), although it does serve breakfast. However, this was not a problem as there are many restaurants in the area, and the hotel receptionist gave us a very good dinner recommendation closeby. Rothenburg as a town is delightful - an old walled town which is wonderful to stroll around. Quaint narrow little streets. There was a festival on the weekend we visited, which added to the buzz. Loads of attractive old buildings and little bars and restaurants. Definitely worth a visit if your are in the area.
reviews.title: Great location, nice large room

reviews.text: Just returned from a 11 day trip around Germany. This hotel and town were definitely the highlight of a wonderful trip. I cannot recommend them highly enough. The room was immaculate and spacious with a huge bathroom. It is located in the center of town within a stones throw to everything you will want to see. The food and service at the restaurant was great. Though Rothenburg is a tourist mecca after 5PM you almost have the place to yourself. Don't miss this charming hotel and town.
reviews.title: A Perfect Stay
Loved this Hotel
reviews.text: We booked Room 34, the penthouse. It was so amazing! Charming, big, private balcony. Peaceful. Friendly staff. Wonderful town to spend a weekend. We really fell in love with it. We very much recommend this hotel. Everything is affordable, the food is great. The visit will always be remembered as one of the best. Nothing bad to say at all. It is within the walls.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Gotisches Haus for only one night in mid-August, 2007. We regret that we did not confirm it for two nights. Our room was on the 2nd floor, overlooking the mid-evil cobblestone streets of old walled Rothenburg. The room was divided into 2 rooms, one for sitting and the other for sleeping. Our room was equiped with a king bed and a hugh bathroom. Two heavy terry cloth robes were furnished for after bath comfort. The beautiful decor combined with the heavy deluxe drapes, upscale bedding, made for a very romantic setting.
reviews.title: Romantic small hotel

reviews.text: What a wonderful stay this turned out to be! This hotel oozes with charm and history. Our room and bathroom were both very large and roomy.
reviews.title: Our favorite hotel in Germany!

likes.liked: — The fact that a 600 year old hotel can be so charming, yet have very modern facilities

reviews.text: I have always stayed at the Hotel Eisenhut in Rothenburg, but decided to try the Gotisches Haus when I found it on TripAdvisor. I am so glad we tried this hotel!
reviews.title: Darling little hotel

reviews.text: We stayed in room 21 on the second floor. This room is very large with both a bed and a small couch that pulls out into a bed. I was travelling with my 2 children and the 3 of us had plenty of room. The bathroom was very large (even by American standards) and was very modern and clean.
